newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian rubber prices down at close.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian rubber prices down at close.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices lost their midday firmness to close lower, with traders saying the market had to succumb to weak consumer demand.
"Prices have to come down...we are still much higher than Indonesia," said a trader in Kuala Lumpur.
At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quote May RSS1 buyer at 297.50 cents () a kg, down a cent from Monday. May SMR20 buyer was a cent lower at 285.50.
An official trade source said the only known business for the morning was 500 tonnes of SMR20 transacted for Dubai at 284.50 cents a kg for late April delivery.
Dealers in private trading houses quoted the SMR 20 at 284/285 cents a kg for May, SMR CV at 351, SMR L at 331, SMR 5 at 293, SMR 10 at 286 and drum latex FOB at 235.
Dealers said although prices were coming down, they still had some way to go before being able to compete with Indonesia.

The INRO five-day moving indicator was quoted at 227.96 Malaysian/Singaporean cents per kg on March 31, down from the 228.25 on March 27. The daily indicator also ended lower at 228.34 against 228.70 previously.
